On Mon, 2003-09-22 at 13:05, Michael T. Peterson wrote:
> Now, to enable the java language assertions requires that certain flags
> (-ea) be passed to the java command.  However, in my tests, JUnit invokes
> the java command.  So, how to I tell JUnit to pass the -ea (or other flags)
> to the java command?

For clarification, it's the Ant task that invokes the java executable,
not JUnit.  JUnit is a framework, not an executable.  I belive you can
add a JVM argument to the <junit> task like this: <jvmarg value="-ea"/>.

=jason
